text: Day House is a historic home located at Springfield, Greene County, Missouri. It was built in 1875, and is a two-story, five bay, "L"-plan brick dwelling. It features a mansard roof with triple dormers. It was the home of Springfield businessman and local politician, George Sale Day. (includes 4 photographs from 1975) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1976. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1875 Category:Buildings and structures in Springfield, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Greene County, Missouri
title: Day House (Springfield, Missouri)
